availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel R. Springer (Union County, Kentuckym blacksmith)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, blacksmith. North Carolina native. Married to M. A. Springer. Father of William D. Springer, Sarah E. Springer, George F. Springer, James M. Springer, Sam H. C. Springer, John T. Springer, Willis G. Springer, Martha A. Springer, Nancy E. Springer, Mary B. Springer, and Vicey N. Springer. Blacksmith in Union County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 495A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 60.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Morganfield Precinct, p. 26.
